The_Boom_Chucka_Boys:
{{Short description|Canadian country/rockabilly band}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = The Boom Chucka Boys | image = | caption = | image_size = | alias = | origin = [[Sylvan Lake, Alberta]], [[Canada]] | genre = [[Country music|Country]], [[rockabilly]] | years_active = 2010–present | label = Cache Entertainment, [[Royalty Records|Royalty]] | associated_acts = [[Gord Bamford]], [[Byron Hill]] | website = {{URL|http://www.theboomchuckaboys.com/|theboomchuckaboys.com}} | current_members = Ryan Langlois
Joel Rathjen
Teddy Roy Michaylow
Ben Shillabeer
Neil MacDonald | past_members = Dave Grobe }} '''The Boom Chucka Boys''' is a Canadian [[country music|country]] and [[rockabilly]] band from [[Sylvan Lake, Alberta]] composed of Ryan Langlois, Joel Rathjen, Teddy Roy Michaylow, Ben Shillabeer and Neil MacDonald.{{cite web|title=The Boom Chucka Boys on CBC Music|url=http://music.cbc.ca/#/artists/The-Boom-Chucka-Boys|website=[[CBC Music]]|accessdate=September 11, 2014}} The band was formed in July 2010.{{cite news|last1=Weber|first1=Mark|title=Boom Chucka Boys unleash 'rockabilly and classic country'|url=http://www.reddeerexpress.com/entertainment/Boom_Chucka_Boys_unleash_rockabilly_and_classic_country_211255751.html|accessdate=September 11, 2014|work=Red Deer Express|date=June 12, 2013}} They were discovered by [[Gord Bamford]] in January 2011 and signed a record deal with his company, Cache Entertainment.{{cite news|last1=Ledingham|first1=Lani|title=The Boom Chucka Boys will make you shake your boogie woogie|url=http://rdc.ab.ca/about/alumni-foundation/alumni/blog/boom-chucka-boys-will-make-you-shake-your-boogie-woogie|accessdate=September 11, 2014|work=[[Red Deer College]]|date=February 14, 2014}} Their self-titled debut album was released in April 2013 and distributed by [[Sony Music Canada]]. It was produced by [[Byron Hill]] and recorded in [[Nashville, Tennessee]]. The first single, "Find My Peace of Mind", was released in March 2013 and peaked at number 43 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Canada Country]] chart. In 2014, The Boom Chucka Boys were nominated for the [[Canadian Country Music Association]] Award for Group or Duo of the Year.{{cite news|last1=Michelin|first1=Lana|title=Boom Chucka Boys have shot at country music group of year|url=http://www.reddeeradvocate.com/entertainment/Boom_Chucka_Boys_have_shot__at_country_music_group_of_year_268335022.html|accessdate=September 11, 2014|work=[[Red Deer Advocate]]|date=July 23, 2014}} The band signed with [[Royalty Records]] in 2014 and released their second album, ''Ramble'', on February 10, 2015. The album features three singles: "Turn This Car Around" released in October 2014, "Rebel Wings" released in February 2015 and "Can't Take My Lips Off You" released in August 2015. ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! style="width:14em;"| Title ! style="width:24em;"| Details |- ! scope="row"| ''The Boom Chucka Boys'' | * Release date: April 30, 2013 * Label: Cache/[[Sony Music Canada]] |- ! scope="row"| ''Ramble'' | * Release date: February 10, 2015 * Label: [[Royalty Records]]/Sony Music Canada |- |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:14em;"| Single !
